module.p:
Examples from Gairm –
[...] “Rinn e òran dhomh. Oran briagha. [...] Cha robh sinn ach fichead bliadhna a dh’ aois. [...] ’Se Sasunnach a bh’ ann [...]. Cha robh e ach fichead bliadhna a dh’ aois. Balach àrd tapaidh le léine shìoda. Thubhairt e rium gum pòsadh e mi. [...] Thainig e mach á sgoth-luing le na siùil gheala. Cha robh facal Gàidhlig aige. [...] Tha thu coltach ris,” thubhairt i ri Iain leis an aon ghàire. “Leig leis,” arsa Màiri. “Chan ann airson sin a thàinig e.” [...]
[...] “He sang me a song. A beautiful song. [...] We were just twenty years of age. [...] He was an Englishman [...]. He was just twenty years of age. A tall strong boy with a silk shirt. He said to me that he would marry me. [...] He came out of a yacht with white sails. He didn’t have a word of Gaelic. [...] You look like him,” she said to John with the same laugh. “Leave him alone,” said Mary. “He didn’t come for that.” [...] td. 170–1, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
